tables.title: Segment Strategy Table
tables.description: This table presents strategies and examples for different customer segments.

cells: Short-Term Inactive
Prevent cardholder from becoming long-term inactive
Send a message via direct mail, email, or SMS reminding the cardholder that using the card for every purchase helps them manage budgets and earn rewards with every dollar spent

rows.row_label: Low Spenders or High Potential Profit
cells: Low Spenders or High Potential Profit
Optimize recurring payment penetration. Encourage a new spending habit on the card
Statement credit for enrolling in recurring payments, e.g., with utilities or memberships
High Spenders or Declining Usage
Prevent account attrition by providing a spending incentive
Spend $3,000 in the next three months before account renewal to have the annual fee waived
High Spenders
Increase average spend or share of spend
A “spend and get” promotion with a high spending threshold: Spend $4,500 per month in the next two consecutive months and receive a free companion ticket when purchasing airfare
Category Non-Spenders
Increase share of spend through category expansion
Spend $100 in category X in the next three months and receive 500 bonus points

rows.row_label: New Cardholders Who Only Transferred Balance
cells: New Cardholders Who Only Transferred Balance
Stimulate regular purchasing on the card
Provide a retail incentive offering a special APR of 1.99% on all grocery store spending in the next three months
Cross-border
Promote cross-border spend
Offer no foreign currency transaction fee
Recurring Payments
Promote recurring payment transactions
Offer more points earned for recurring payment transactions
eCommerce
Promote online spending
Promote safety and security on purchases made online. Offer special deals for online merchants
